ref: 10611 *radhyatē ʻ is softened ʼ (act. radhyatu ʻ let him subdue ʼ AV.). 2. raddha -- ʻ subdued ʼ RV. [Cf. randhi imper. ʻ subdue ʼ, radham inj. ʻ may I submit ʼ, radhrá -- ʻ weak ʼ RV., randhayati ʻ cooks ʼ MānGr̥. -- √randh]
Sh. ražóĭki̯ ʻ to be cooked (in a pot) ʼ;
S. rajhaṇu ʻ to be boiled or stewed, be inflamed or angry ʼ;
H. rajhnā ʻ to be cooked or boiled ʼ (with a for ā in intr.: caus. rajhānā).
